snippet: The British oil company said it had agreed to pay fines and accept charges related to the rig explosion two years ago that killed 11 people and caused a giant oil spill in the Gulf of Mexico.
abstract: BP agrees to pay $4.5 billion in fines and other penalties and to plead guilty to 14 criminal charges related to 2010 rig explosion that killed 11 people and caused giant oil spill in Gulf of Mexico; Justice Department also files criminal charges against BP employees Robert Kaluza, Donald Vidrine and David Rainey; settlement does not resolve possible penalties of up to $21 billion that company could owe in pollution fines under Clean Water Act.

byline.original: By CLIFFORD KRAUSS and JOHN SCHWARTZ
byline.contributor: Clifford Krauss reported from Houston and John Schwartz from New York. Contributing reporting were Julia Werdigier and Stanley Reed in London, Charlie Savage and John M. Broder in Washington and Campbell Robertson in New Orleans.

lead_paragraph: The British oil company said it had agreed to pay fines and accept charges related to the rig explosion two years ago that killed 11 people and caused a giant oil spill in the Gulf of Mexico.

headline.main: BP Will Plead Guilty and Pay Over $4 Billion
